> " Must we always assume the worst Cheetor? Must we always follow a simila=
r path even if it may lead us over a cliff to our demise? Talon is right, P=
erceptor risked his own life so that we may still remain functionable. If h=
e were to turn his back on us, he would have done that vorns ago. Now, I wi=
ll not hear another negative word about Perceptor. Not in my pressence. He =
has risked his life for us, and now we must do him the respect of showing h=
im our thanks for his efforts. Now, enough bickering, we have a tunnel to s=
eal off and Rodimus Prime to bring back online. I'm sure he wouldn't want t=
o see any of you bickering either. Am I understood Cheetor?"

Cheetor looke=
d at Tuscon, his optics cool yet dim, then he finally
nodded, "You are in c=
harge." he said, sounding sullen and crestfallen.
"If you say it, then it m=
ust be true." He turned and began walking
back toward the Ark, his shoulder=
s slumped, his head bowed a little.

Ramulus had glanced back at Cheetor an=
d then Tuscon, and then just
shook his head again as he continued to walk a=
way. He had been helping
Rhinox, perhaps it was time for him to return to t=
hat mission. Too
much time around the Ark never made him feel good. he pref=
ered the
wide open out doors, not to be confined to and one spot.

> "Wow, =
ya know Lord Elder, he may not be able ta see, but he sure knows his words =
of wisdom. Definitely what Optimus Prime would've done."

Lord Elder watche=
d Cheetor walk back to the Ark as well, as he
listened to Quickstride. Elde=
r folded his arms behind his back as he
turned to look back at Quickstride,=
 "Is it?" Elder asked.

"Trust cannot be demanded or commanded only earned.=
" He said quietly.
"Cheetor was not with you to watch the events that you s=
aw that caused
you to come to trust Perceptor, how can he be expected to tr=
ust
without it?" Elder's voice was not accusatory but calm and reasoning.
"=
Cheetor only knows what he sees here and now, and that is a Predacon
that h=
e has fought against for a long time. It will take time to get
over that, t=
o see him as a companion, perhaps one day as a friend."

Elder turned to lo=
ok back at Perceptor, "And it will take Perceptor
time to come to realize h=
is new role here, and that the life that he
has known has ended, he has a n=
ew part to play."

Elder looked at Cheetor and Ramulus for a moment, watchi=
ng each one
walk away in different directions. "It is Tuscon's job now to b=
ring us
together, unite us under a common banner. That is the hardest part =
of
being a leader, not just leading but inspiring others to follow."

Elder=
 turned to follow after Cheetor, his steps quick to catch up with
the swift=
 Maximal, he would need a pep talk.
